intro: Meibomia campylocaula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often twisted stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and革质 (leathery). Its flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and are often white or pale pink in color. Meibomia campylocaula is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests or along stream banks.
